thread.title: The Dollar Rescued Ecuador. Can It Save Venezuela? - WSJ

author: John Otis
title: The Dollar Rescued Ecuador. Can It Save Venezuela? - WSJ
text:
QUITO, Ecuador—Devalued and derided, this country’s former currency, the sucre, has been out of circulation for so long that when shopkeeper Raúl Jumbo was shown an old 20-sucre coin he didn’t recognize it.
Ecuadoreans have grown accustomed to U.S. dollars, which their government adopted in 2000 to overcome soaring inflation and the sucre’s collapse. A similar action is now being proposed for Venezuela by Henri Falcón, an opposition candidate in the inflation-racked country’s May 20 presidential election. Dollarization is...
